definition: steady as Mt Tai/as safe as houses
settled/steady/stable
as/as if/such as
Mt Tai 泰山[Tai4 Shan1] in Shandong/abbr. for Thailand
safe/peaceful/most/grand
surname Shan
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable

sentences.english: Your lack of routine upsets this steady sign.
sentences.chinese: 你的不守规矩会让这个稳如泰山的星座苦恼不安。

sentences.english: Is your overall Investment Portfolio ALL Weather Proof as well?
sentences.chinese: 是你的整体投资组合是否也是稳如泰山？

sentences.english: So long as no problems arise in those two bodies, China will be as stable as Mount Tai.
sentences.chinese: 只要这个环节不发生问题，中国就稳如泰山。

sentences.english: As long as you don't betray me, I'll do whatever you ask me to (do).
sentences.chinese: 只要这个环节不发生问题，中国就稳如泰山。

definition: as secure as Mount Taishan/as solid as a rock
calm and composed (idiom)
to not move a single jot (idiom)
as solid as rock (idiom); as sure as houses
cool and collected (idiom); showing no sign of nerves/perfectly composed
solid as a boulder (idiom); absolutely secure/rock-firm and unyielding
everything steady and stable (idiom); overcautious and unimaginary
calm/unruffled
reliable/secure/stable/firm
secure as a city protected by a wall of metal and a moat of boiling water (idiom)/well fortified/invulnerable to attack
grasp it and victory is assured/to have success within one's grasp (idiom)
boulder
Panshi county level city in Jilin prefecture 吉林, Jilin province
see 泰然處之|泰然处之[tai4 ran2 chu3 zhi1]
precarious as pile of eggs (idiom); ready to fall and break at any moment/in a dangerous state
to talk and laugh as though nothing had happened/to remain cheerful (despite a crisis)
to sit upright
